item.title: SBSTR1
item.description:
Given two binary strings, A (of length 10) and B (of length 5), output 1 if B is a substring of A and 0 otherwise.

Input

24 lines consisting of pairs of binary strings A and B separated by a single space.

Output

The logical value of: 'B is a substring of A'.

Example

First two lines of input:

1010110010 10110
1110111011 10011
First two lines of output:
1
0

  
    #include <iostream>
    #include <string>
    using namespace std;
    int main()
    {
        for (int i = 0; i < 24; ++i)
        {
            string a, b;
            cin >> a >> b;
            if (a.find(b) == string::npos) // A long long line
            {
                cout << "0\n";
            }
            else
            {
                cout << "1\n";
            }
        }
        return 0;
    }
item.dc:creator: Chintan Ghate

item.title: PRIME1
item.description:
Peter wants to generate some prime numbers for his cryptosystem. Help him! Your task is to generate all prime numbers between two given numbers!

Input

The input begins with the number t of test cases in a single line (t<=10). In each of the next t lines there are two numbers m and n (1 <= m <= n <= 1000000000, n-m<=100000) separated by a space.

Output

For every test case print all prime numbers p such that m <= p <= n, one number per line, test cases separated by an empty line.

Example

Input:
2
1 10
3 5

Output:
2
3
5
7

3
5

  
    #include <iostream>
    #include <cmath>
    using namespace std;
    int main()
    {
        int T;
        cin >> T;

        for(;T--;)
        {
            int a, b;
            cin >> a >> b;

            for (int i = a; i <= b;="" ++i)="" {="" if="" (i="=" 2)="" printf("%d\n",i);="" }="" (i%2="" !="0" &&="" i="" bool="" flag="true;" for="" (int="" j="3;" <="sqrt(i);" j+="2)" if(i%j="=" 0)="" break;="" (flag)="" printf("\n");="" return="" 0;="" pre="">
item.dc:creator: Chintan Ghate

item.title: TEST
item.description:
Your program is to use the brute-force approach in order to find the Answer to Life, the Universe, and Everything. More precisely... rewrite small numbers from input to output. Stop processing input after reading in the number 42. All numbers at input are integers of one or two digits.

Example

Input:
1
2
88
42
99

Output:
1
2
88

  
    #include <iostream>
    using namespace std;
    int main()
    {
        int n;
        while(cin >> n)
        {
            if(n != 42)
                cout << n << "\n";
            else 
                break;
        }
        return 0;
    }
item.dc:creator: Chintan Ghate
